comment.author: 16978334@N06
comment._content: Really an excellent, interesting, and beautiful shot!

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content:
I remember 1948 in Newcastle upon Tyne, when everything was drab after the War.
This photo of Gothenburg is colourful.
Life before a forest of road signs and double-yellow lines.
Today there is probably a law against eating ice-cream while riding a bike.

comment.author: 41001225@N04
comment._content: The man was carring a coffee in his hand while cicling :)

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/aliera]  I remember in the 1940s there was ice cream in a cardboard cup, with a small wooden spoon.
I cannot remember take-away coffee in those days. That came later.
Or maybe Sweden was well ahead of Britain then.

comment.author: 41001225@N04
comment._content:
I first taught it could be ice cream.
Because it looks like a cup I chanced on coffee, but yes ice cream would be safer :)
